notes: Double clicking the item casts it on self.
Applies a cyclone effect on the target upon cast, turning it invulnerable and fully disabled.
Applies a basic dispel on the target upon cast.
Cyclone first applies the invulnerable, then the dispel.
Can only target enemies, self or own Meepo clones and Tempest Doubles. Cannot target other allies, wards, or buildings.
While in the air, other units may pass below the cycloned unit.
The damage is applied at the end of the duration. If the cyclone gets dispelled, it still applies the damage as soon as the target lands.
The damage is only applied to enemy targets.
Can be cast on Roshan, but has no effect, since Roshan is immune to forced movement. The damage is still applied.
abilities.name: Cyclone
abilities.description: Sweeps a target unit up into a cyclone, making them invulnerable for 2.5 seconds. Cyclone can only be cast on enemy units or yourself. Enemy units take 50 magical damage upon landing.

description: A mysterious scepter passed down through the ages, its disruptive winds can be used for good or evil.
trivia: The scepter's name is a reference to Eul, the creator of the first DotA map back in 2003.
Crystal Maiden's cosmetic item, Eul's Scepter of Divinity, is based on Eul's Scepter of Divinity and shares its name.
tips: Use the Cyclone offensively by disabling an enemy before a gank, giving you the time to set up your abilities.
Use the Cyclone on fleeing enemies to give your team the time to surround the target.
Use the Cyclone on enemies in teamfights to take them out of the fight for a few seconds. This is especially effective on carries.
Use the Cyclone on yourself during teamfights, baiting enemies into using their abilities on you, then becoming invulnerable to interrupt their burst damage.
Use the Cyclone to buy yourself a little more time for abilities and items to come off cooldown, especially items like Blink Dagger or Blade Mail.
Use the Cyclone on an enemy who has activated items like Blade Mail, Satanic, or Lotus Orb. Doing so will waste the duration of those items.

Eul's Scepter provides a cheap and beneficial dispel for support heroes who are very susceptible to silences. So when facing a lot of silences, or other strong but dispellable effects, Eul's Scepter is usually the best option.
The bonus movement speed works well with other items that increase movement speed, such as Phase Boots.
attrs: Bonus +10 Intelligence +5 Mana regeneration +6% Movement speed
info: For strength heroes, it grants 6% movement speed, 120 mana, 5.5 mana regen and 0.7% spell damage.
For agility heroes, it grants 6% movement speed, 120 mana, 5.5 mana regen and 0.7% spell damage.
For intelligence heroes, it grants 6% movement speed, 150 mana, 5.63 mana regen, 0.88% spell damage and 10 attack damage.
Movement speed bonuses from multiple Eul's Scepters of Divinity fully stack.
Stacks with all other movement speed bonuses.
